subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text: Compound of {{compound|ja|sort=ひじり|日|tr1=hi|t1=day, light, the sun|知り|tr2=shiri|t2=knowing}}. The ''shiri'' changes to ''jiri'' due to {{rendaku|ひじり}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|ひじり}}

# a very [[virtuous]] or [[godly]] person; a [[saint]]
# {{qualifier|honorific}} the [[emperor]]
# a [[sage]]
# an [[expert]]; someone [[distinguished]] in their field
# a [[virtuous]] or [[high-ranking]] [[Buddhist]] [[priest]] or [[monk]]
# a Buddhist priest or monk in general
# a monk who has gone into [[seclusion]] for purposes of [[asceticism]] and [[spiritual]] [[enlightenment]]
# a monk who has adopted an [[itinerant]] lifestyle for purposes of [[asceticism]] and spiritual enlightenment, supporting themselves by gathering [[alms]] and food [[contribution]]s; by extension, an itinerant [[preacher]] monk from [[Mount Kōya]]
# {{lb|ja|euphemistic|sort=ひじり}} alternate name for {{l|ja|清酒|tr=seishu|gloss=refined [[sake]]}}
# a [[textile]] [[peddler]] {{qualifier|from the resemblance to itinerant {{l|ja|高野聖|tr=''Kōya hijiri''}} Buddhist [[preacher]]s who would carry everything on their backs}}
